extracted_nodes.label: kb_Capability
extracted_nodes.name: Direction Finding
extracted_nodes.description: Capability to detect direction of arrival for signals.

text:
WEVR Antenna

The WEVR antenna provides directionfinding capabilities to support 2 GHz to 18 GHz ELINT missions at a low SWaP. Four RF N-channel outputs and a dedicated scan channel are driven by proprietary state-of-the-art cavity backed spiral antennas and a slant polarized omni directional scan element. In high-cosite areas, WEVR features selectable filter bands to mitigate interference.

3 When coupled with Mastodonsensors, de-tection, identification/classification, and direc-tion-finding (OF) of ; 5 Ae iia wideband radar signals are possible in operational environments such as ground and maritime with minimal SWaP.

extracted_nodes.label: kb_Software
extracted_nodes.name: Mephisto
extracted_nodes.description: Tactical ELINT User Interface for Mastodon.

text:
*Future release

Intuitive User Interface

The real-time display available in Mastodon's Tactical ELINT User Interface, Mephisto, provides operators with an easy-to-use software to functionally control and monitor the system. The de-interleaver and classifier, Medusa, provides a light-weight yet highly capable solution for detecting and classifying both conventional and agile radar targets effectively. Medusa supports both hardware and database flexibility to ensure the Ul experience can be customized to fit any Mission profile.

extracted_nodes.label: kb_System
extracted_nodes.name: Harpy
extracted_nodes.description: Wideband Multi-Channel Receiver optimized for ground tactical and manpack operations.

extracted_nodes.label: kb_System
extracted_nodes.name: eKraken
extracted_nodes.description: Tactical ELINT sensor optimized for platform-ground tactical and maritime vehicles.

text:
Harpy Wideband Multi-Channel Receiver

Harpy is a variation of the Mastodon Tactical ELINT sensor, eKraken, optimized for ground tactical, land mobile, and manpack operations. Building upon the ekKraken, which was optimized for platform -ground tactical and maritime vehicles deployment, Harpy is a multi-function, SWaP-reduced offering ideal for manpack usage. Harpy includes support for survey and DF, high-speed offload capability for external processing and spectrum recording, and a future bolton transmit channel for effects delivery. Harpy was developed to build off the battle-proven eKraken system, while optimizing for low SWaP, man-packable battery operations and building in high-speed I/O and transmit functionality for expanded use cases.

extracted_nodes.label: kb_Asset
extracted_nodes.name: 2590 Series Battery
extracted_nodes.description: Power source for the Harpy system.

text:
Rugged & Tactical

Harpy's incredibly small form factor is optimized for manpack-able and SWaP constrained applications, designed to be battery powered but easily adaptable to platform power sources. Harpy measures 7.0 inches wide, 7.75 inches deep, and 4 inches high and weighs less than 9.0 pounds without a battery. Harpy is designed to meet MILSTD environmental requirements, supports a wide power input range of 9-36 VOC with reverse polarity, and is operated with the 2590 series of batteries.

Multi-Mission Operations

The Harpy supports intercept and DF for traditional and Frequen-cy-Modulated Continuous Wave (FMCW) radars. The sensor pro-vides 4 native channels of 500 MHz Instantaneous Bandwidth (IBW) simultaneous receive from 500 kHz to 18 GHz. The high-speed I/D supports mission requirements for spectrum recording or external processing applications. Expansion capability is planned via a bolt-on Sth channel module for expanded scan Capability and to support transmit exploit effect delivery, with external power amplification.

extracted_nodes.label: kb_Standard
extracted_nodes.name: JICD 4.2
extracted_nodes.description: Joint Interface Control Document for collaborative ELINT.

text:
Future Proof

Mastodon continually invests in adding capabilities and en-hancements to this hardware platform. Planned JICD 4.2 (JEL) capability will provide support for collaborative ELINT operations. Integrating customer feedback and technological advancements, Harpy will continue to adapt as your mission requirements change.
